required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Augmented Reality for Shoulder Pain and Scapular Dyskinesis
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of Augmented Reality Combined With Scapular Repositioning Exercises in Patients With Chronic Shoulder Pain and Scapular Dyskinesis: a Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to analyze whether an Augmented Reality based scapular stabilization exercise program is more effective than conventional programs in patients with chronic shoulder pain and Scapular Dyskinesis.

study_design_info.masking_description: The researchers involved in measuring outcomes will not be aware of treatment allocation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, change from baseline at 1-month, change from baseline at 2-months, change from baseline at 3-months, and change from baseline at 6-months
primary_outcome.description: Pain intensity measured with a visual analogue scale which ranges from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst imaginable pain).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, change from baseline at 1-month, change from baseline at 2-months, change from baseline at 3-months, and change from baseline at 6-months
secondary_outcome.description: Shoulder disability measured with Shoulder Pain and Disability Index (SPADI), which ranges from 0 (no disability) to 100 (maximum degree of disability).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, change from baseline at 1-month, change from baseline at 2-months, change from baseline at 3-months, and change from baseline at 6-months
secondary_outcome.description: Arm disability measured with Disabilities of the Arm, Shoulder, and Hand (Quick-DASH), which ranges from 0 (no disability) to 100 (maximum degree of disability).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, change from baseline at 1-month, change from baseline at 2-months, change from baseline at 3-months, and change from baseline at 6-months
secondary_outcome.description: Kinesiophobia measured with Tampa Scale of Kinesiophobia (TSK-11), which ranges from 0 (no kinesiophobia) to 100 (maximum degree of kinesiophobia)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, change from baseline at 1-month, change from baseline at 2-months, change from baseline at 3-months, and change from baseline at 6-months
secondary_outcome.description: Pain catastrophism measured with Pain Catastrophism Scale (PCS), which ranges from 0 (no catastrophism) to 100 (severe catastrophism).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in shoulder range of motion
secondary_outcome.description: Shoulder range of motion in abduction, flexion, internal and external rotation, measured with a goniometer

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, change from baseline at 1-month, change from baseline at 2-months, change from baseline at 3-months, and change from baseline at 6-months
secondary_outcome.description: Electromiographic activity of serratus anterior, upper trapezius, lower trapezius, and deltoid medimum muscles. Percent of electromiographic activity as a function of maximum voluntary isometric contraction, as well as latency of muscle activation during scaption will be recorded.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Agumented Reality combined with scapular exercises
arm_group.description: Scapular exercises performed with glasses of augmented reality during sessions at clinic, and without glasses at home.
Scapular exercises performed all the time without glasses.

intervention.description: The subjects will perform scapular repositioning exercise using glasses of augmented reality to see their scapular movement simultaneously. Furthermore, they will also see at the same time a video record of an "ideal" scapular movement, and will me encouraged to simulate that "ideal" scapular movement.
intervention.arm_group_label: Agumented Reality combined with scapular exercises

intervention.description: Subjects will perform scapular repositioning exercises for improving scapular movement.
intervention.arm_group_label: Agumented Reality combined with scapular exercises

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Unilateral mechanical shoulder pain of nonspecific origin (non-traumatic) lasting at least 3 months.
- Weakness in flexion, abduction and/or external rotation isometric strength testing.
- Presence of scapular dyskinesis according to Kibler, Scapular Assistance Test, and Scapular Reposition Test.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous shoulder surgery.
- History of shoulder fracture or glenohumeral luxation.
- History of acromioclavicular joint injury.
- Presence of massive rotator cuff rears.
- Presence of frozen shoulder.
- Cervical hernias or radiculopathy.
- Fibromyalgia.
- Neuropathic pain.
- Cervical and/or vestibular problems with dizziness, unsteadiness, or vertigo.
- Medical contraindication for performing exercise (cardio-vascular or cardio-pulmonar diseases, systemic diseases, metabolic diseases in non-controlled acute state).
- Blindness.
- Actually being treated with physical therapy for shoulder pain.

contact.last_name: Ruben Fernandez-Matias (Institute Physical Therapy and Pain)
